Posts.Content: Hello everyone, hope your all doing okay.  Ive just started radiotherapy and Im also taking tamoxifen and have had one zoladex injection.  I know this time of year there are lots of bugs and viruses going around, I have flu like symptoms and just feel washed out, has anyone felt like this during rads and if so is it okay to keep having it done whilst you feel so crap?  I will ask when I go back but I just wondered if anyone experienced this too. x
Posts.Title: radio therapy

Posts.Content: Hi Topsy Im going through much the same as you at the moment.  Ive just started Hormone treatment which will be a monthly injection of Zoladex for 2years and 5years of tamoxifen.  I am going next week for radiotherapy prep.  Its all very up and down and ive been a mixed bag of emotions and it is very scary ..... hope your doing okay, try and keep positive :) xxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Hi Topsy, thats okay, I hope your doing okay.  My r/t is finished now, thank goodness! I was tired during it but a lot of that was the journey every day.  My skin is just now very red, dry and looks and feels like ive had a bad sunburn!  The hormone treatment has kicked in, hot flushes and sleepless nights but, no periods so thats a definate bonus for me!  Hope your coping okay with your treatment. All the best xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy I am 9 months into treatment, zoladex & tamoxifen.  Im finding it very tough, flushes, lack of sleep and weight gain.  Get tearful too, and it does seem like its a on a rota.. Also, when I go for my injection,everytime,my GP always asks, so has your oncologist not decided to go for the 3month injection yet then?? Everytime I say, no, its not registered for breast cancer treatment and I only know this because the prev GP told me this and the one before that!!! I know its an expensive medication, but I would so rather not be having it done.  Sorry, that was my rant as Ive just been for one today and come out feeling really peed off that they keep going on about it!! I keep thinking that Im putting myself through this and in 2years time, my periods could return and I could be in the same boat and have gone through this rollercoaster for nothing.  At night I have a fan on constant and have done so for the past 8 months ... I can guarantee that I will be awake after 2hours sleep, downstairs for some water then back to toss and turn until my alarm goes off for work .... something tells me this cant be right.  On a good note, no periods, this is good for me as i did suffer!   Sorry that ive gone on a bit ,... that is my experience with both meds ... not good but something I think we just need to deal with!  take care xx
Posts.Title: Zoladex & Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi I had the same op as you in September, i didnt feel too bad afterwards and was home in the evening, I did find my arm hurt more than where the actual lump was removed.   I did feel in limbo until I received my results 2weeks later, I think this is the normal timescale.  I was initially told that I would more thank likely have chemo followed by R/T. but, as the cancer is estrogen-receptor positive it was decided the R/T and hormone treatment was for me.  I managed to work through the R/T, albeit very tired, and finished just before Christmas.  I have been on monthly injections of zoladex which will be for 2years and 5years of tamoxifen, which I must admit, side effects kicking in! Wishing you all the best ..... Let us know how you are getting on xxx :)
Posts.Title: In 4 hours I'll know...

Posts.Content: Hi Hannah Hope it all went okay with your op and your recovering well. xx
Posts.Title: In 4 hours I'll know...

Posts.Content: Hiya Good to hear your recovering okay.  You do feel a bit left in the dark, being discharged and then having to wait for your results.  I found trying to keep mobile and doing as much as normal as possible helped!  Fingers crossed for you when you go back in feb for your results. x
Posts.Title: In 4 hours I'll know...

Posts.Content: Hi Hannah Ive just caught up with your news. Im so glad your scan is all clear.  It must be a worrying time for you, hope your WLI went okay today.  My lump was the same, grade 2 and ER&PR + but not HER2.  I cant give you advice on the chemo Im afraid as I didnt have to go through that, but Im sure there is lots of advice can be given on here.  Hormone treatment side effects are tough for me but slowly getting used to it!  You are brave and strong and its a journey with a rollercoaster ride!  But you will get there!  Take care xx
Posts.Title: In 4 hours I'll know...

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon, Thanks, Im sorry to hear that you have to go through it all again, what is ahead of you now? I will just have to put up with the hot flushes and menopause symptoms I suppose but they say when the medication stops then that should too, here's hoping!  Wishing you all the best. x :)
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy, tamoxifen and zoladex

Posts.Content: Hello everyone and I hope you are all doing well, Im starting radiotherapy in a couple of weeks time and tamoxifen and zoladex next week, I just wondered if anyone had bad side effects with tamoxifen & zoladex? Ive been reading up on them and a bit worried of the side effects they could have.  Im not at all concerned about having radiotherapy, been to see Oncologist today and my mind is at rest, albeit the 50mile round trip everyday will be tiring but its only 3weeks out of my life! :) x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy, tamoxifen and zoladex

Posts.Content: Hi Tessa Yes, I suppose you are right, like every drug there are side effects but not everyone will get them!  Im hoping to just get back into a proper routine and taking the tamoxifen and monthly injection will just be part of that routine and not too noticeable in my day to day living!! With regards to driving for radio, yes mostly probably, my other half will come probably for first couple of sessions and friends have offered to take me but its a lot to expect anyone to do everyday for 3weeks! Thanks for your feedback, hope your keeping well! :) x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy, tamoxifen and zoladex

Posts.Content: Hey All Hope you are all doing good.  I cant believe its been a year since my life was turned upside down!  Ive been lucky and have only had to deal with living with a dent in my breast, hot flushes, weight gain and mood swings!  I now have a nervous time as my first mammogram beckons and then waiting for the results afterwards .... worried it might hurt too .... any advice ??
Posts.Title: 1 Year On, Mammogram Due .. nervous
